briefdescription.para: Suppresses snapshots that are historical, removing the metadata for lazy snapshot loading.

detaileddescription.para:
Note that the snapshots are not considered removed from metadata and no RemoveSnapshot changes are created. A snapshot is historical if no ref directly references its ID.

briefdescription.para: Build the TableMetadata object.

simplesect.para: A Result containing the constructed TableMetadata or an error

briefdescription.para: Destructor.
Private constructor for building from empty state.
Private constructor for building from existing metadata.
Builder class for constructing TableMetadata objects.

detaileddescription.para: This builder provides a fluent interface for creating and modifying table metadata. It supports both creating new tables and building from existing metadata.

Each modification method generates a corresponding MetadataUpdate that is tracked in a changes list. This allows the builder to maintain a complete history of all modifications made to the table metadata, which is important for tracking table evolution and for serialization purposes.
If a modification violates Iceberg table constraints (e.g., setting a current schema ID that does not exist), an error will be recorded and returned when Build() is called.
